function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Close interaction in public places after the end of quarantine","category":"Public Space","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of effective treatment for newly emerging infectious diseases such as covid-19","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased risk of viral spread within homes due to prolonged periods spent indoors with family members and limited ventilation.","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate quarantine facilities within homes for infected individuals, leading to increased risk of transmission within the household.","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Overcrowding in public areas of multi-story apartment buildings","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Transmission of infection through shared surfaces and common facilities in residential complexes","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Poor air quality in homes","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of proper ventilation and indoor air quality iaq","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poor ventilation and indoor air quality iaq leading to the transmission of airborne viruses like covid-19","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate sound insulation in multi-story apartment buildings","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate natural light and views leading to reduced psychological well-being and immunity","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Covid-19 survival time in aerosols ranging from 90 min to 3 hours","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Aerosols with the virus can remain suspended in the air for extended periods of time and travel over distances of more than one meter","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Small infectious droplets can travel for up to 4 meters in quiet, enclosed environments","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inefficient air flow patterns in hvac systems","category":"Energy Cycle","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Transmission of infectious diseases through hvac systems","category":"Energy Cycle","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate natural ventilation leading to infection spread","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate building design for air flow patterns","category":"Buildings/Blocks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate hvac systems contributing to covid-19 transmission","category":"Energy Cycle","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Harmful effects of uv rays on humans","category":"Nature","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Inadequate air flow control in hvac systems","category":"Energy Cycle","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential ineffective use of uv lamps for killing viruses, harmful organisms, and bacteria in homes","category":"Nature","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Reliance on houseplants as a sole solution for air purification in naturally ventilated homes","category":"Nature","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Inadequate access to sunlight or daylight in buildings","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of proper ventilation and air circulation in limited-sized domestic spaces","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate consideration of climatic conditions in balcony design may lead to indoor environmental conditions that are conducive to disease transmission.","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Noise pollution in residential clusters due to urban design and building configurations","category":"Neighbourhoods/Districts","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Increased energy consumption in unoccupied public buildings during lockdown","category":"Energy Cycle","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Challenges in controlling the consumption of natural resources in epidemic-resilient homes","category":"Nature","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increase in household energy consumption due to extended periods of time spent at home during quarantine","category":"Energy Cycle","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of energy independence during complete lockdown","category":"Energy Cycle","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inefficient energy consumption in unoccupied buildings during lockdown","category":"Energy Cycle","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Improper disposal and treatment of wastewater from people infected with covid-19 affecting water, soil, environment, and living organisms","category":"Water Cycle","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Presence of coronavirus genetic material in wastewater with increasing prevalence of covid-19 infection","category":"Water Cycle","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Fecal-oral transmission of infectious diseases through wastewater","category":"Water Cycle","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Fecal-oral transmission from improper waste disposal practices","category":"Waste Management","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Emergence of new solid waste from the pandemic, including contaminated medical waste and increased household waste","category":"Waste Management","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increasing consumption of fresh water in residential buildings during quarantine","category":"Water","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Improper treatment of sewage contaminated with the virus leading to contamination of fresh water sources","category":"Water Cycle","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Increased use of chlorine in drinking water during distribution as an additional precaution","category":"Water","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of ventilation and airflow in residential spaces leading to increased risk of disease transmission","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate spatial design leading to overcrowding and close contact among residents","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient separation of different zones within homes leading to cross-contamination among different areas","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poor air quality contributing to increased number of deaths","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Survival of sars-cov-2 in the air and on surfaces","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inefficient treatment of outside air in hvac systems may lead to the escape of microscopic particles, including covid-19 viruses, into treated air, posing a risk of infection.","category":"Energy Cycle","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Indoor air pollution contributing to the spread of covid-19","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exposure to indoor pollutants as a result of poor ventilation","category":"Dwelling","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Covid-19 can be transmitted by inhaling the virus from more than one and a half meters.","category":"Air","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Spread of particles from infected individuals throughout a room or indoor location","category":"Air","confidence":"High"}]}
